headline: Chevron's High Confidence Is Driving It to Wager Over $2 Billion That It Will Close This Needle-Moving Acquisition
summary: In late 2023, Chevron (NYSE: CVX) made a bold move by agreeing to acquire Hess (NYSE: HES) for $53 billion.  The transaction will enhance and extend the company's production and free cash flow growth outlook into the next decade.  Chevron is so confident it will win that it recently bought about 5% of Hess' stock on the open market, valued at over $2 billion at Hess' current $46.5 billion market cap.

headline: Exxon challenges Colonial Pipeline on proposed changes to fuel shipping terms
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Top U.S. oil major ExxonMobil asked regulators to block changes proposed by the Colonial Pipeline to its fuel shipping terms, citing potential harm to shippers and consumers, a filing with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) showed.  The Colonial Pipeline, a key 5,500-mile (8,851 km) artery for shipping fuel from the U.S. Gulf Coast to the East Coast, this month sought approval from FERC to stop shipping different grades of gasoline at the same time and to reduce the total number of grades it moves on the pipeline.  The changes would mark one of the most significant overhauls on the longest U.S. fuel pipeline, which Colonial says will help it ship more fuel by streamlining operations and minimizing slowdowns.

headline: ExxonMobil and Woodside Approve $221M Turrum Gas Project
summary: XOM and Woodside take a final investment decision on the $221M Turrum project, expected to help avert Australia's looming gas shortfall.
